alert.note: Alert for DeWitt; Lavaca (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 13 at 9:24AM CDT until May 13 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHEASTERN DEWITT AND SOUTH CENTRAL LAVACA COUNTIES... At 924 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Thomaston, Arneckville and Meyersville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
